title: Bruins, Marco Sturm must do their ‘homework’ to fix team’s top flaw for stretch run
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins coach Marco Sturm identifies the penalty kill as the team's top priority during the Olympic break.
Boston ranks 28th in the NHL for penalty kills, negating only 76.4% of opposing power plays this season.
Sturm highlights the need to reduce penalties as the Bruins rank second for penalty minutes, affecting momentum.

title: This Boston Marathon bombing survivor is running with Miles for Miracles
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Juliana Hermenegildo is running the 2026 Boston Marathon with Miles for Miracles to support Boston Children's Hospital.
Her son, Tiago, underwent open-heart surgery at Boston Children's Hospital and is now a healthy toddler.
Survivor of the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing, Hermenegildo aims to heal and honor her son's journey.

title: Teaming up with Al Horford against Celtics will be ‘weird,’ Kristaps Porzingis says
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kristaps Porzingis to make his Warriors debut against Boston Celtics after recovering from POTS and an Achilles injury.
Al Horford and Kristaps Porzingis, former Celtics players, joined the Warriors through offseason moves and trade.
Stephen Curry will miss Thursday's game against the Celtics due to knee pain, affecting the Warriors' lineup.

title: Celtics reportedly bring back Dalano Banton on 10-day contract
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Celtics signed Dalano Banton to a 10-day contract after he completed a similar deal with the Clippers.
Banton played two games for the Clippers this season and averaged 6.7 points over five NBA seasons.
The Celtics also signed rookie John Tonje to a 10-day contract after acquiring him from the Jazz earlier this month.

title: Here’s why Ed Markey is boycotting the State of the Union — and what he and others are doing instead
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Sen. Ed Markey will skip President Trump's State of the Union to attend the 'People’s State of the Union' rally.
MoveOn and MeidasTouch organized the rally on the National Mall with several Democratic lawmakers participating.
Rep. Seth Moulton plans to attend Trump's address, bringing Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a detained immigrant teen, as his guest.

title: South Boston St. Patrick’s Parade to follow new route for 250th Evacuation Day
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: The 2026 South Boston St. Patrick's Parade will start at Andrew Square, altering its traditional route.
The new route honors Henry Knox’s march during the Revolutionary War and commemorates Evacuation Day's 250th anniversary.
A family-friendly zone will be designated at Medal of Honor Park; City Councilor Ed Flynn supports the changes.

title: New England has the best open-air and maritime museums in America, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Plimoth Patuxet Museums in Plymouth, Massachusetts, named top open-air museum by USA Today readers in 2026 awards.
Maine Maritime Museum in Bath, Maine, ranked as best maritime museum in America according to USA Today 10Best Awards.
Old Sturbridge Village, Massachusetts, and Mystic Seaport Museum, Connecticut, also honored in top three for their categories.

title: Second worker exposed to gas at Maine pulp mill dies
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Allen Hornberger, 26, died after nearly three weeks in critical condition following toxic gas exposure at a Maine pulp mill.
The incident at Woodland Pulp in Baileyville occurred on Jan. 27 during a plant shutdown, exposing two workers to a lethal gas.
Kasie Malcolm, a University of Maine intern, also died after the gas exposure; company cites inhalation hazard as the cause.

title: Warriors’ Stephen Curry to miss Thursday’s game against the Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stephen Curry will miss Thursday's game against the Celtics due to ongoing knee issues.
Curry has not played since January 30, missing a total of 16 games this season.
Kristaps Porzingis will make his Warriors debut against the Celtics, replacing Curry.

title: Local obituary: Bob Aliano, worked as a Roslindale barber for 67 years
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Bob Aliano, former owner of Rialto Barber Shop in Roslindale, passed away on February 14, 2026, at age unspecified.
He worked as a barber in the community for 67 years and was a longtime resident of West Roxbury.
Visiting hours will be held on February 22 at P.E. Murray – F.J. Higgins, George F. Doherty & Sons Funeral Home.
